io.github.goodees.ese.core

Class EntityInvocationHandler<E extends EventSourcedEntity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.goodees.ese.core.EntityInvocationHandler<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of entity this runtime handles

    public class EntityInvocationHandler<E extends EventSourcedEntity>
extends Object
    Common logic for facade to speaking with entities. It instantiates the entities, recovers their state, manages their snapshots and invocation lifecycle. In order for recovery to work, the runtime needs EventLog to see the past events, and SnapshotStore for storing the snapshots. Entities will then need to be created with an EventStore that uses as is consistent with the EventLog.

    This class allows for many direct and indirect invocations of the entity. For all of them it assures correct initialization of the entity, as well as its cleanup in case of event store errors.

    Request lifecycle

    When request is due for invocation, the runtime will perform following steps:

    1. Obtain an up-to-date instance, as described by EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle
    2. Pass the request to the instance. Subclasses of runtime define the contract between runtime and entity
    3. When call completes, handleCompletion(String, EventSourcedEntity, Throwable) executes following logic:
      1. Entities invocation state will reflect successful or unsuccessful completion
      2. Method EventSourcedEntity.performPostInvocationActions(List, Throwable) is called to handle post invocation side effects}
      3. If the call completes exceptionally:
        1. When it was due to exception from storage processing, the entity will be removed from cache, so it would be recovered into fresh state on next request. The call with result in EventStoreException, regardless of exception handling within the entity.
        2. A runtime can optionally choose to retry the request, e. g. like implemented in DispatchingEventSourcingRuntime
        3. The returned future completes exceptionally
        Otherwise, the future completes successfully with the value returned by entity
      4. if runtime decides it EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle.shouldStoreSnapshot(EventSourcedEntity, int) should store snapshot of entity state}, and entity provides a snapshot, it will be stored.
    See Also:
    AsyncEventSourcingRuntime, SyncEventSourcingRuntime

    • Method Detail

      • invokeSync

        public <R,X extends Exception> R invokeSync(String entityId,
                                            EntityInvocationHandler.ThrowingInvocation<? super E,R,X> action)
                                     throws X extends Exception
        Invoke an action on an entity. This is the most straightforward type of call.

        We are returning completable future, so that it is easy to either chain the calls, or synchronously wait. However the clients should not call any mutation methods of the CompletableFuture, such as CompletableFuture.complete(Object). They may, and in current implementations will, throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of request
        X - Checked exception of the action
        Parameters:
        entityId - the identity of the entity to be called
        action - the action to perform on the entity
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture of the result.
        Throws:
        X - if action throws.
        X extends Exception
        See Also:
        EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle

      • invokeSync

        public <R,X extends Exception> void invokeSync(String entityId,
                                               EntityInvocationHandler.ThrowingInvocation<? super E,R,X> action,
                                               java.util.function.BiConsumer<R,Throwable> callback)
        Invoke an action of an entity and pass the result to a callback. This is useful in dispatching scenarios, where the completion stage returned to client must get completed with a result.
        Type Parameters:
        R - result type
        X - exception type
        Parameters:
        entityId - entity id
        action - the action to perform on an entity
        callback - pass the result or thrown exception

        Invoke an asynchronous action on an entity. Asynchronous action return completion stage as result.
        Type Parameters:

        Type Parameters:

        action - asynchronous action
        callback - callback accepting the result of the call, which is either answer or a throwable

        public void invokeWithCallback(String entityId,

        Let client invoke the action, and transfer the result to invocation handler.
        Parameters:
